snippet: The Stanley Cup finals saw its share of weird bounces and deflections. While the Rangers believed “the hockey gods” may have played a part in the series, the Kings did not buy it.
abstract: Stanley Cup finals were marked by a high number of theatrical bounces, deflections and near-misses; both the New York Rangers and victorious Los Angeles Kings seem to have experienced their fair measure of good and bad luck throughout the series.
lead_paragraph: The Stanley Cup finals saw its share of weird bounces and deflections. While the Rangers believed “the hockey gods” may have played a part in the series, the Kings did not buy it.

headline.main: Talk of Puck Luck Bounces Both Ways for Both Teams
headline.print_headline: Talk of Puck Luck Bounces Both Ways for Both Teams
